intro: Drimia barkerae, commonly known as the Cape tiger's claw, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking purple or white flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
